verses.roman:
asvargyam ayaśasyaṁ ca
phalgu kṛcchraṁ bhayāvaham
jugupsitaṁ ca sarvatra
hy aupapatyaṁ kula-striyaḥ

synonyms: asvargyam—not leading to heaven; ayaśasyam—unfavorable for a good reputation; ca—and; phalgu—insignificant; kṛcchram—difficult: bhaya-āvaham-creating fear; jugupsitam—contemptible; ca—and: sarvatra-in all cases; hi—indeed; aupapatyam—adulterous affairs; kula-striyaḥ—for a woman coming from a respectable family.
translation: For a woman from a respectable family, petty adulterous affairs are always condemned. They bar her from heaven, ruin her reputation and bring her difficulty and fear.
